term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - ground level inversion in atmospheric chemistry
term.title: ground level inversion

item.text: The inversion of the normal temperature gradient in the atmosphere; the temperature of the air increases with increasing height of the air above the ground. This leads to poor mixing of gases released below the inversion.

sources.item: PAC, 1990, 62, 2167. 'Glossary of atmospheric chemistry terms (Recommendations 1990)' on page 2193 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199062112167)
